text: The American Psychiatric Association (APA) is a group of psychiatrists in the United States. The group is responsible for writing the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, which is used to diagnose mental illnesses. It has about 36,000 members. Its members are from USA and other countries in the world. The APA was founded in 1844. ==References== Category:Psychiatry Category:1844 establishments in the United States Category:Medical and health organizations in the United States
title: American Psychiatric Association
